subSections.title: Compounds
Noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|いくさ|yomi=k}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=いくさ|-}}, first attested in the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'' (720 {{CE}}).
* The ''iku'' part is possibly derived from either {{m|ja|射くう|tr=ikuu||to [[shoot]] (an [[arrow]])}}, {{m|ja|的|tr=ikuha||[[target]]|pos=archaic}}, or classical verb {{m|ja|生く|tr=iku||to [[exist]], [[live]]; [[bring]] to [[life]]}}.
* The final ''sa'' is likely from {{m|ja|矢|tr=sa||[[arrow]]|pos=obsolete}} or {{m|ja|さ|tr=-sa|pos=suffix attached to verbs to mean “[[do]]ing [[time]]”‎ or to nouns indicating direction}}.

The original sense referred to an [[army]] or [[soldier]]s, then at the time of the ''{{w|Nihon Shoki}}'' (720 {{CE}}) extended to mean "[[archery]]", then finally "an [[exchange]] of arrows" → "a [[battle]]".
